dataModel

Class SiteFormatAttribute

  • java.lang.Object
    • dataModel.SiteFormatAttribute

  • public class SiteFormatAttribute
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a single attribute that is part of a site format. It is associated with one attribute name. It is functionally represented by an ordered list of AttributePatterns. These patterns represent an ordered list of the HTML tags that must be traversed to find the desired item attribute.
    Author:
    David Tickner

    • Constructor Detail

      • SiteFormatAttribute

        public SiteFormatAttribute(AttributeName name,
                   java.util.List<AttributePattern> patterns,
                   java.lang.String finalAttribute)
        Parameters:
        name - The AttributeName of this Attribute
        patterns - The AttributePatterns to identify this Attribute
        finalAttribute - if the value of this attribute is read from an HTML attribute rather that the body of an HTML tag then set this to the name of the attribute. Otherwise set it to null.

    • Method Detail

      • getAttributeName

        public AttributeName getAttributeName()
        Returns:
        The AttributeName object that identifies this attribute

      • getAttributePattern

        public java.util.List<AttributePattern> getAttributePattern()
        Returns:
        The attributePatterns that are used to find this Attribute

      • getFinalAttribute

        public java.lang.String getFinalAttribute()
        Returns:
        if the text for this SiteFormatAttribute is to be parsed from a tag attribute rather than the tag body then this method returns the name of the attribute to use

      • addAttributePattern

        public void addAttributePattern(AttributePattern pattern)
        Add a newpattern to the set of AttributePatterns.
        Parameters:
        pattern - The new pattern to add

      • parseItemAttribute

        public java.util.List<ItemAttribute> parseItemAttribute(Item item,
                                               org.htmlcleaner.TagNode rootItem)
        Parse any attributes identified by this object from a given HTML fragment.
        Parameters:
        item - The Item that the parsed attributes will be associated with
        rootItem - The HTML fragment that the attributes will be parsed from
        Returns:
        A list of the attributes that were found. This will often be of length one.
